page.title: 18THE CHURCH
page.content: {ALL SAINTS}in Langton Green, was built of local sandstone by Sir George Gilbert Scott, in 1863. It is in the 'Victorian Gothic' style. The stained glass window in the North aisle is dedicated to Lord Baden Powell. The vicar is the Rev. Channer. The Church plays a large part in the local community. It runs social activities in the village, and organises many events to raise money for charity. Among the Church Groups are: The Mothers' Union, Youth Groups, Sunday School, and the Choir. The main meeting place for church related activities is the Watson Hall. {ST. PETER'S}in Fordcombe, was built in 1847 for The 3rd Viscount Harding, in the 'Old English' style. The rector of Penshurst, the Rev. Tyler_Whittle, is the acting vicar.
